sentences.sContent: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.sCn: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.sContent: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.sCn: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.sContent: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.sCn: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

sentences.sContent: ...Even the impression of bias may cause some students to feel that they have been treated unfairly...
...I hope to make a good impression on your family...
...Some fast-food firms provide healthy food to give the impression they are helping to tackle the obesity problem...
...who always leaves a deep impression on you by demonstrating her passion for life and the spirit of never yielding...
...others are under the impression that electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...

exam.question: Almost all job applicants are determined to leave a good ______ on a potential employer.

answer.explain: 句意： 绝大多数求职者都决心给有可能成为自己未来雇主的人留下好印象。illusion： 幻想； reputation： 名声； reflection： 倒影。

synos.tran: 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想

phrases.pCn: 让人眼前一亮；给人留下…的印象
长久的印象；不可磨灭的印象
印象管理；印象操纵；印象整饰

words.tran: 感人的；令人钦佩的；给人以深刻印象的
印象派的；印象主义的；给人深刻印象的
敏感的；感受性强烈的；易感动的
印象主义者；印象派作家
盖印；强征；传送；给予某人深刻印象

trans.tranOther: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem
